body.directions: Read each word or phrase in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Whom do you most likely see at the site indicated by the word presented?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 寺庙 sìmiào means “temple,” and you can most likely see monks here instead of doctors, police officers, or professors.
body.incorrect: Oops…View the word several times and maybe sound it out to help you remember the meaning of the word and what site it indicates. Then consider what type of persons you can see at the site.

body.quiz: Which of the following words does not share a character with the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 衣服 yīfu (clothes)
options: Audio for 剧院 jùyuàn (theater)
Audio for 医生 yīshēng (doctor)
Audio for 衣服 yuànzi (yard)
body.correct: Job excellently done! The first character, 医, in the word 医院 yīyuàn (hospital) is shared by 医生 yīshēng (doctor); the second character, 院, in it is shared by 剧院 jùyuàn (theater) and 院子 yuànzi (yard). The only word that has neither character is 衣服 yīfu (clothes).
body.incorrect: Almost. Identify the audios in the choices, sound out the words, and identify their characters. Then compare them with the two characters in the word presented to see which choice has neither character in it.

body.quiz: In which of the following situations will you call help from the place indicated by the word presented?
options: When my house is on fire
When I prepare for my final exam
body.correct: Job excellently done! The word 警察局 jǐngchájú means “police department.” You will call for the police’s help when a crime is committed, such as a car stolen.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Think about the meaning of the word and what place it indicates. Then review the situations in the choices and consider which one suits the service the place provides.
